competitors.name: Omnisend
competitors.notes: Most direct Klaviyo competitor for ecommerce, combines email, SMS, web push, and automations; easier to use and cheaper

competitors.name: Mailchimp
competitors.notes: Most popular email marketing solution for ecommerce brands with simple functionality and strong market dominance

competitors.name: ActiveCampaign
competitors.notes: Full-service marketing automation platform with easy-to-use email editor and advanced ecommerce features

competitors.name: Drip
competitors.notes: Ecommerce marketing platform for email & SMS (acquired by Redbrick in 2020)

competitors.name: Shopify Email
competitors.notes: Native Shopify email marketing solution for ecommerce stores

competitors.name: GetResponse
competitors.notes: Omnichannel marketing platform with email, SMS, landing pages, and webinars

competitors.name: HubSpot
competitors.notes: Comprehensive platform with CRM functionality, broader ecosystem than Klaviyo's ecommerce focus

competitors.name: Brevo
competitors.notes: Affordable option suitable for small businesses and creators

competitors.name: Yotpo
competitors.notes: Acquired SMSBump in 2020 and Swell Rewards in 2018, expanding into ecommerce marketing space

context: By 2020, the ecommerce email marketing landscape had evolved significantly with increased focus on omnichannel approaches (email + SMS + push notifications). Klaviyo faced competition from established players like Mailchimp and ActiveCampaign, as well as specialized ecommerce competitors like Omnisend and Drip. The market saw consolidation with Drip being acquired by Redbrick in 2020. SMS marketing was becoming increasingly important.
